Yes, there were other factors that contributed to Studio Ghibli films' eventual success, both in Japan and worldwide. These include:

1. Critical acclaim: Some of the Studio Ghibli films received critical acclaim from film critics, which helped the films gain more visibility and positive word-of-mouth from audiences.

2. International recognition: Many of the Studio Ghibli films received international recognition, including nominations and awards at prestigious film festivals and awards ceremonies, which helped expose the films to a wider audience.

3. Merchandising: Although Studio Ghibli did not rely heavily on merchandising to promote its films, it did create merchandise related to the films, which broadened the films' appeal to fans.

4. Home video and streaming: The home video and streaming markets played an essential role in the success of Studio Ghibli films, as fans were able to discover and share the films more widely than before.

5. Re-releases: Some of the Studio Ghibli films were re-released in theaters, often with updated animation and sound, which allowed fans to experience the films in a new and improved way.

These and other factors contributed to the eventual success of Studio Ghibli films, which have become beloved classics in the world of animation.
